knowledg.title: HTML
knowledg.dis: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard language used to create and structure pages on the web.

knowledg.title: CSS
knowledg.dis: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and layout HTML elements, including colors, spacing, and responsiveness.

knowledg.title: JS
knowledg.dis: JavaScript is a programming language that adds interactivity, dynamic behavior, and logic to websites and web applications.

knowledg.title: React
knowledg.dis: React is a JavaScript library for building fast and interactive user interfaces using a component-based approach.

knowledg.title: Redux
knowledg.dis: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps, often used with React to manage complex application state.

knowledg.title: Express JS
knowledg.dis: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides robust features for building APIs and web apps.

knowledg.title: Node JS
knowledg.dis: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime that allows developers to run JavaScript on the server side, enabling full-stack development with JS.

knowledg.title: MongoDB
knowledg.dis: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents, making it ideal for modern web applications.

knowledg.title: Unity
knowledg.dis: Unity is a cross-platform game engine used for developing both 2D and 3D games, simulations, and interactive experiences.

knowledg.title: Blender
knowledg.dis: Blender is a powerful open-source tool for 3D modeling, animation, rendering, and visual effects used in games and film.
